message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE

This paper deals with word embeddings, which are commonly used in natural language processing (NLP) tasks such as text classification, sentiment analysis, and machine translation. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which focuses on NLP and related areas. 

The paper also discusses the use of graph-based algorithms, which are commonly used in machine learning and data mining. This suggests that cs.LG (Machine Learning) is another likely sub-category. 

Additionally, the paper proposes a method for infusing syntactic knowledge into word embeddings, which is a common problem in NLP. This suggests that cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval) are also likely sub-categories. 

Finally, the paper discusses the performance of the proposed algorithm on small datasets, which suggests that cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is a possible sub-category as well.
